proof.text: For from the medial straight line  let there be subtracted the medial straight line  which is commensurable with the whole  in square only and such that the rectangle , , which it contains with the whole , is medial; [elem.10.28] I say that the remainder  is irrational; and let it  straight line.

For let a rational straight line  be set out, let  equal to the squares on ,  be applied to , producing  as breadth, and let  equal to twice the rectangle ,  be applied to , producing  as breadth; therefore the remainder  is equal to the square on . [elem.2.7]
Now, since the squares on ,  are medial and commensurable, therefore  is also medial. [elem.10.15 elem.10.23.p.1]
And it is applied to the rational straight line , producing  as breadth; therefore  is rational and incommensurable in length with . [elem.10.22]
Again, since the rectangle ,  is medial, therefore twice the rectangle ,  is also medial. [elem.10.23.p.1]
And it is equal to ; therefore  is also medial.
And it has been applied to the rational straight line , producing  as breadth; therefore  is rational and incommensurable in length with . [elem.10.22]
And, since ,  are commensurable in square only, therefore  is incommensurable in length with ; therefore the square on  is also incommensurable with the rectangle , . [elem.10.11]

But the squares on ,  are commensurable with the square on , [elem.10.15] and twice the rectangle ,  is commensurable with the rectangle , ; [elem.10.6] therefore twice the rectangle ,  is incommensurable with the squares on , . [elem.10.13]
But  is equal to the squares on , , and  to twice the rectangle , ; therefore  is incommensurable with .
But, as  is to , so is  to ; [elem.6.1] therefore  is incommensurable with . [elem.10.11]
And both are rational; therefore ,  are rational straight lines commensurable in square only; therefore  is an apotome. [elem.10.73]
But  is rational, and the rectangle contained by a rational and an irrational straight line is irrational, [deduction from elem.10.20] and its ’side’ is irrational.
And  is the ’side’ of ; therefore  is irrational.
And let it be called  straight line. Q. E. D.
